name: Flatter Me
description:
Flatter Me is a compliment battle card game for two players that makes giving and receiving compliments a little easier — by turning compliments into a competition! This quick-to-learn, family-friendly battle of kind words takes 15 to 30 minutes to play.

As in the classic card game War, each round, both players simultaneously reveal the top card from their stack. If your revealed card best suits your opponent's personality, they take both cards; if their card best suits your personality, you get both! In the event of a tie where both cards fit both players or neither card is a good fit, draw three more cards and reveal the fourth. Winner takes all. Repeat until the tie is broken!

Once both stacks are gone, whoever received the most compliment cards wins.

name: Double Date Simulator
description:
Double Date Simulator is an 18 card microgame for 2-4 people in which players take on the role of hyper-powered matchmaking algorithms and compete to see who can most successfully organize one of the most elusive of social gatherings, the double date!

Players take turns drafting cards representing different artificial dater personas and placing them into couples, each of which will form a unique scoring condition based on their couples' interests. After three separate simulations, the player with the most points wins, proving once and for all that ROBOTS CAN LOVE. Or, more accurately, proving once and for all that robots who are dating can hang out with other robots who are dating and have a MUTUALLY SATISFACTORY TIME doing so.

-description from designer

name: StrikeZone: Baseball Tabletop Game
description:
Compete with friends and family in this action-packed tabletop baseball experience that's fun for all ages - indoors or out!

Steps to setup the game:

     Roll out your 5x5 baseball diamond.
     Flip a coin to see who bats or pitches first.
     Load the StrikeZone baseball into the Pitcher's hand. Pull back on the spring-loaded lever and release to fire the plunger into the back of the ball - sending it towards home plate.
     With your left-hand, pull on the Batter's Line to raise and lower his arms and the bat. With your right-hand, pull back on the home plate lever to rotate your Batter's hips and swing through the ball.


How to score:

     If you hit the ball to a Catcher, Fielder, or Pitcher before it hits the ground - you're out!
     If you ground hit the ball to a Catcher, Fielder, or Pitcher - you hit a single. (StrikeZone uses ghost runners to run the bases).
     If you ground hit a ball past everyone - you hit a double or a triple based on where it rolled off the edge of the field (as marked by a 2 or a 3 on the field).
     If you hit a fair ball in the air past everyone and above The Blue Monster - you hit a homer!
     For an extra fun rule twist, we recommend giving human players (whoever's pitching or on defense) the ability to catch a ball in mid-air. Catch the ball before it hits the ground or the basement wall and save a run!
     Strikes, balls, foul balls, outs and hitting the Batter with a pitch all follow traditional baseball scoring rules.


How does a player win:
Just like in Baseball, a player to score most in thier innings is a winner.

—description from the publisher

name: TorKings
description:
TorKings is the game connoisseur’s (geek-worthy) extreme upgrade of the classic game of alignment.

There’s new rules, new game options and hardware from the distant future. It's now a whole lot more than the old game of line up 4!

The games now range from the classic game of Align4 (4 in a row) to TorLord – the creative mode where you win title of TorLord or TorKing and the right to change and evolve your own rules of engagement with a diversified set of tokens.

In between those games are the games of TorGalor and TorKings – both radical and massive improvements to the game of alignment that truly unleash the genre’s strategic depth and gameplay diversity to the next level.

Then there’s the new interactive cooperative team play mode that blows the dynamics out of the water even further.   A game mode that really hits the sweet spot with satisfying, engaging fun for families and friends.
New Developmental Tool:  With both enhanced strategy games and interactive cooperative team play, TorKings is a new cross purposed STEM and Social IQ building tool.  Idea for developing minds and team building alike.

The Geek Spectrum:  TorKings gameplay is adaptive to suit the full spectrum of players. Pick your board size, pick your game and pick your team.  Wherever you lie on the spectrum – there’s a game option to suit.

As immersive and fun as good Euro-games are they are unfortunately cursed by lengthy rules that are difficult to access, long gameplay and lengthy setup.

TorKings is a complete matrix of game options to suit your occasion. The rules are super accessible, the game depth is selectable from newb to guru, the game duration is also selectable, the setup practically instant, you can play on a single, double or triple sized board and you can play one-on-one or play interactively in teams! – That’s one freaking convenient and dynamic piece of gameware!

So players of all ages can dive into the fun of the game of their choice in no time. – Quick, easy, super engaging and a load of fun!

Way Back: The classic game of alignment goes back 5 decades (released as Connect4 in 1974). It’s one of the most popular board games in the western world.  We’ve either grown up with it (or a clone) or we’ve been adults with kids who have played it to infinity and beyond.

But it’s a classic - so why change it?  The answer is that the gameplay is massively underdeveloped!
The telling proof of that is the general attrition of the game by the time players hit their tweens. Albeit - they then grow up and return to the game for a similar time period with their own kids!

The reasons for tween attrition are many but the most important factor is that the gameplay of chasing a single alignment is not strategically rich enough to maintain interest for naturally expanding minds.  It’s too confined, too routine and lacks diversity.  If only those problems could be fixed…

By comparison other strategic games like Go and Chess have a good following as minds mature.  Those games have the strategic richness to match and engage evolving minds.
But how do you make the game of alignment strategically richer to engage growing and mature minds? The answer is layered but here are the basic elements of the solution: 
1.    Kill the sudden death approach. 
   •    Getting a single alignment is fun.  But getting multiple alignments is a lot more fun - so in the new rules a side wins by getting the most alignments in a game.
   •    That finally opens up the new possibility of getting more points for multiple alignments.
   •    As the game plays on through alignments there is a far richer move and counter-move dynamic set up.   The dynamic shift to achieving the more dynamic multiple alignments while of course blocking the bigger game or your opponent.
   •    Such a simple and obvious rule change – but with a massive cascade of instantly compounding strategic depth and dynamics
•    You now also get paid for each new alignment you make - from your opponents unplayed tokens.  That’s also the super simple way you keep score! Again super satisfying and adding another layer of risk management, separation anxiety and competitive dynamics. – Genius!
2.    Expand the game board size
   •    Modular board games allow the board to get wider and that finally allows the strategic development to expand.  The result - a massive increase in player engagement and satisfaction.
3.    Introduce a diversity of token characters with new properties to meaningfully contribute to the gameplay and diversify game options further.  A satisfying upgrade for seasoned strategists.
4.    Open up interactive co-op team play
   •    The modular boards are a total natural fit for others to join and play interactive cooperative team games.  The result is a further cascade in dynamics as the human element is introduced.  It’s easily one of the most fun ways to play. It’s also one of the most accessible co-op styled board-games in the world! A true contender that may finally bring cooperative styled boardgaming into the mainstream!
Flexibility: The options above can be toggled on or off in different game options to allow players to grow into the new gameplay levels.  Combining all of the above entirely unleashes the true potential of the strategic alignment genre.  Once you play the new games it feels strange indeed that it’s taken 5 decades to finally make this most obvious transition.

The Revolutionary New Hardware:
   •    Smart Tokens: Now your tokens finally sort themselves and shoot straight back at you at the press of a button.  That gives you more game time and turns the tedious task of manually sorting tokens into a magic treat for everyone, every game!
   •    Modular Gameboards: Players can now join up to 3 boards together to make a bigger fully integrated board.  The result is a massive boost to gameplay diversity and depth.
   •    Iconic 3D tokens:  We’ve turned design thinking inside out when we developed the TorKings tokens.  They are a mixture of sculpted 3D forms and voids beautifully framed by the surrounding torus.  They are a breakthrough in visual accessibility that allows token diversity to explode along with gameplay depth.  They are also very tactile and visually stunning in the game grid.
   •    Snap Latch : We’ve put an end to the violation of your tokens randomly releasing in the middle of your game.  The snap latch snaps shut and secures your game.
   •    Spinners:  The tokens can spin in a variety of ways.  They are handy as timers, selectors and impressively cool play things in their own right.
   •    Safety:  The tokens re designed to allow airflow regardless of orientation in an airway. That allows parents to breathe a little easier when younger kids inadvertently wander into the mix.
   •    Premium Quality: We’ve designed the game to be a very different premium journey for players of all ages. It’s a completely new level of enjoyment and fun.

Description from the designer - James T.

name: 1718 Dice Game
description:
1718 Dice game is a free PNP. PDF attached. Its a good excuse to throw lots of dice. The famous Black Beard pirate died in 1718. This simple pirate dice game was inspired by 3 dice games Roll for it, Age of War and Los Banditos.

On a turn. Each player rolls his/ her available dice and will try to allocate the dice to match the requirements of the cards they want to claim in the hoard.

Action cards are grey. They give no points, but allow you to do special permanent actions on your turn. they are cumulative  They are aquired through "battle" with dice. The dice battle could last more than 1 turn.

—description from the designer

name: Tabletop WWII
description:
Historical Miniature Wargame rules for WWII

From Battlegroup to division / corps level.

Includes:

     basic rules
     advanced rules, 
     troops, organization and equipment for divisions
     point system and 
     scenarios

name: Tabletop Napoleonics
description:
Historical Miniature Wargame rules for the Napoleonic era.

From Battlegroup to division / corps level.

Includes:

     basic rules,
     advanced rules, 
     point system to create armies,
     scenarios

name: Peltast and Pila: Rules for Ancient Wargaming 300 B.C. to 500 A.D.
description:
Simple Historical Miniature Wargame rules for the Ancient period, from the end of the chariot to the Dark Ages.

It is a modernization to round figures of an earlier set of rules designed to be played with flats.

The basing is compatible with WRG rulesets of the same era.

Scales:

     2mm = 1 m
     1 turn ~ 2'30"


These rules have been republished in a compilation titled Tony Bath's Ancient Wargaming, part of the History of Wargaming project by John Curry in 2011, in collaboration with the Society of Ancients.

- User summary

name: Seekriegs-Taktik
description:
This is a naval battle simulation between a German and an English fleet. Movement of the ships is determined depending of the ships class. A battleship for instance moves 3 spaces per turn whereas a light cruiser moves 4 spaces. 
The goal of the game is to destroy or cripple the enemy fleet.
Hits are settled by rolling 3 dice and consulting a hit table.
The players may create their own scenarios for the game.

The ships have to be colored, cut out and glued together.

—user summary

name: Lords Of Zanora
description:
The players take the roles of the Lords of Zanora in this fast paced card game. The realm of Zanora is the home of five sentient species, all having unique abilities. The Lords seek to bring peace and prosperity to Zanora, but it will not be easy to unite the factions after the long years of war.

Player must take 2 of 3 possible actions: draw cards, play cards to form one or more columns/alliances or attack another player's alliance. The topmost faction card of a column  has a special ability. Using this abilities does not cost any actions. The first player to form one alliance of all the 5 different cards is the winner of the game.

Each turn you will have to decide when to expand your alliances, when to block your opponents and which abilities to use to accomplish your goal: the unification of Zanora.

Will you succumb to the web of grudges and destruction or will you be the Lord that brings hope to Zanora?

name: River Raisin: A Cold and Bitter Battle â€“ 1813
description:
“On the 22nd, before daybreak, came within sight of the enemy... such was their security and negligence that... our line was actually half formed within musket shot of their defenses before they were even aware of our presence.” –Canadian volunteer of the 41st Regiment of Foot, January 22, 1813.

Following General Isaac Hull’s surrender of the US Army’s surrender at Detroit, General Harrison was ordered north from Ohio and Indiana to salvage the fast deteriorating situation. Dividing his forces into two columns, Harrison ordered General Winchester to join up with a smaller force of Michigan volunteers at Frenchtown, south of Detroit along the River Raisin while he led another column that would follow later after they assembled from scattered winter quarters. The volunteers and a small detachment that escaped from Detroit at Frenchtown beat back an earlier attack by Canadian militia and their First Nation American allies. Learning of the larger US force coming from the south, British General Proctor left Detroit in the midst of the winter weather to deal with the growing US threat at the River Raisin. One of the most dramatic engagements of the war was about to ensue.

Can you do as well, or better? Learn and enjoy!

—description from designer

name: Splattosaurus
description:
Race through the prehistoric jungle to get to your dinosaurs home. Be careful - your opponent will try to SPLAT your dinosaurs.

In Splattosaurus, players draw a card from the draw deck and either move their dinosaur to the next matching color OR number on the path. If they draw a SPLAT card, then they will splat an opponent's dinosaur already on the path and draw a second card.

Splattosaurus plays similarly to Candy Land for movement with a take-that element added to it.

—description from the publisher

name: Table Top Battles
description:
DBA type miniature wargame rules using a grid system.

They cover all periods, including fantasy and science fiction.

For Use with 6, 10, 15, and 20mm Armies Or 28mm Skirmish Games and includes Solo War Game Rules with a Navy Rules Sheet.

Includes rules for

     campaign,
     solo,
     naval, 
     sieges,
     assault,
     weather,
     air combat...

name: Spaces
description:
Spaces is designed to be enjoyed by players without being limited by their trivia knowledge.  Each Topic Card has questions about a topic and there are always at least 10 correct answers.  Players can be creative (including educated guessing) as they attempt to provide up to 9 answers in the 9 Spaces.

Players score 1 point for each correct answer plus 1 bonus point for getting 9 correct answers (maximum score 10 points per Topic Card)

name: Texas Hold'em with Zombies
description:
Texas Hold'em with Zombies (THZ) is an adventure card game which blends poker strategy with role-playing elements. Players spend rounds of game play betting their life on winning poker hands, collecting much needed item cards, and killing zombies.
Each round, players compete to play these zombies against the other players. Unless you have the right item cards to kill them, barricade against them, or lure them back against the other players who sent them, the undead will eat your chip stacks, your life.
A game is won by the player who best masters the knowledge of suited card play, reading people, weapon and defense item card combinations, and a bit of good 'ole fashioned' luck!

—description from the publisher

name: Spaces: Places Add On
description: Adds 25 place related topic cards to your Spaces game. Can be played as a standalone game, or with the base game and/or any other Add On(s).

name: Spaces: Sport Add On
description: Adds 25 sports related topic cards to your Spaces game. Can be played as a standalone game, or with the base game and/or any other Add On(s).

name: Spaces: Music Add On
description: Adds 25 music related topic cards to your Spaces game. Can be played as a standalone game, or with the base game and/or any other Add On(s).

name: Spaces: Fiction Add On
description: Adds 25 fiction related topic cards to your Spaces game. Can be played as a standalone game, or with the base game and/or any other Add On(s).

name: Mystic Vale: Essential Edition
description:
Mystic Vale - 2 to 4 players take on the role of druidic clans trying to cleanse the curse upon the land. Each turn, you play cards into your field to gain powerful advancements and useful vale cards. Use your power wisely, or decay will end your turn prematurely. Score the most victory points to win the game!

Mystic Vale - Big Box contains the basic version of the game and 3 additions:


     Mystic Vale: Vale of Magic (2016)
     Mystic Vale: Vale of the Wild (2017)
     Mystic Vale: Mana Storm (2017)


—description from the publisher

name: Im Reich der Phantasie
description:
Im Reich der Phantasie from the publisher "Pfiffiger Jakob" by Helmut Huber for 1 to 4 children from 4 years.
It is a small game collection with 4 games:

     The paint tower
     The dinosaur race in 2 variants
     The Saurierfangerl and
     The dinosaur poker


The game materials are stored in a jute sack. For better stacking on the shelf, everything is housed in a small, self-made box.

Der Farbenturm:
A color tower is to be built from 48 round wooden discs in 6 different colors with a color cube. The child must stop rolling the dice when the tower collapses or when the color is no longer available. The child with the highest tower won.

Das Saurierrennen:
A predetermined game board is laid out with the colored wooden discs. The color cube determines whether the dinosaur can move to the next field stone. Whoever reaches the finish line first wins the game.

Saurierfangerl:
Only two people play. The catcher places two dinosaurs on the prepared game board on the two starting fields, the hunted places his saurian on his starting field. The dice are alternately rolled. The catcher tries to get into the field of the hunted, the hunted tries to block the catcher with the black field stones.

Saurierpoker:
Each player gets 2 field stones of each color. Then each player places one of his stones in the middle of the table, they must have different colors. Now the dice are rolled. The player whose color has been rolled gets all the pieces from the center.

name: Kiki va sortir les poubelles
description:
The game where you have to come up with the most stupid excuses! 
Players are flatmates and they have to decide who will take the bins out. To avoid the chore, everyone makes up an excuse with 1 action and 1 object to combine in one areas of the flat. 
Do you have the worst excuse? The bin is for you!

name: Dawn of Legends
description:
In Dawn of Legends, 2 - 4 players will be recruiting Allies, adding Items and learning Tactics to prove their prowess on the battle field. By winning control of each field, promoting your proven assets and gaining more, players score Victory Points. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of 4 rounds wins!

Each round, players take turns, taking a single action each turn, until all players have passed or played their whole hand. Then, players resolve each of the 3 Battle Fields, scoring them and gaining their unique win rewards. The game proceeds in this manner for 4 rounds, after which, players will count the Victory Points they have collected from Tokens, cards they have Promoted as well as cards they own (in their Deck, Hand, Plan and Discard).

On your turn, take one of these Action:


     Prepare Action. Players may discard any card from their hand to put a card from the Market in their Preparation Area (to draw next round).
     Recruit Action. Players may discard 2 cards from their hand to play a card from the Study into their Active Card Slot of their Plan. The Icon(s) on the Recruited card MUST be represented at least once on the 2 cards discarded.
     Play Action. Players may play a single card from their hand into their Active Card Slot.
     Musou Action. Players may (if they still have cards in hand) spend Musou to activate their Legend's unique Musou Ability.


What makes Dawn of Legends unique is the Plan (Player Board) players play cards to. As Cards are played to it or exit it, they have varying effects. Some cards may have effects while they remain in your Plan, while others may protect your Plan or affect your opponents Plan.

—description from the publisher

name: Spellweaving 101
description:
It's the end of your first year as an Apprentice Spellweaver, which means it's time to demonstrate your mastery of the basics of Spellweaving. You and your fellow Apprentices are gathered together in one of the great Training rooms and instructed to weave as many powerful, two-word spells as you can in a certain amount of time. Unfortunately, you all stayed up late last night "studying", and now all the spell words are jumbled in your mind. By quickly sorting through what you do remember, carefully listening to the other Apprentices, and using some of the characteristics of the seven Aspects, can you weave the most impressive spells and be named Apprentice of the Year?

Each player maintains a hand of five cards, either from the Draw deck or the four discard piles. Place cards in your tableau singly or in pairs. Pairs of cards provide points at the end, based on the value of each card's Aspect.

Improve your placed cards to create powerful Bound spells, or use the abilities of your cards to alter the strength of the placed cards, draw more cards, or steal from other players.

Create the most powerful spells, including those listed on your personal Challenge card, to win!

—description from the designer

name: Dice of the Living Dead 2nd edition
description:
Dice of the Living Dead 2nd ed is a free print and play solo game about rolling dice and fighting zombies.

Zombies have overrun your hometown. You and your group of survivors have to make your way to the extraction zone at the outskirts of town. But the streets are swarming with the undead so you'll have to fight your way. Hopefully you have enough ammo and supplies to make it.

Every turn you roll dice trying to find the right balance between moving fast and still having time to fend off the living dead. But just as every roll of the dice can help you, it also holds certain risks.

The second edition features: 

     Event cards
     Modular game board that creates a new path to travel every game. 
     Playable characters
     Exploration tokens
     Stress cards to add extra tension


—description from the designer

name: Psycho Chickens
description:
Psycho Chickens is a card game like no other. In fact, it's so good that you can't even look at it. No, really, you play the game without looking at your cards! Now, there's room for strategy (and a bit of luck) but be careful... play the Psycho Chicken card and you're dead, poof, out.

Each player starts with 3 facedown cards. On their turn, they flip over 1 card and play it, then draw a card (facedown) to replace it. The card they play may instruct them to look at or manipulate some of their cards and/or an opponent's.

When a player plays the Psycho Chicken, they lose.

name: Civil War Map Game
description:
An educational game where the player will master names, locations, important information and characteristics of cities, historical events, and geographical areas surrounding the United States civil war.

The game utilizes the following:
letter scramble
word search
data sheets with historical summaries
map (serves as the board)
cards

name: Megiddo: Le Jeu de Simulation Tactique au temps de Thoutmosis
description:
Large scale tactical level Miniature Wargame rules in the times of the Pharaohs. in French

Minis: 28mm (recommended)

Règle de jeu pour reproduire les batailles de masse de la Haute Antiquité.

name: Aviatrix '37
description:
Aviatrix '37 puts you in the pilot's seat of a vintage Lockheed Electra taking on the role of Amelia Earhart in this engaging, entertaining and realistic re-creation of one of the most talked-about flights in aviation history. You'll need a combination of skill, nerve, patience and smarts as you circumnavigate the globe at the equator along Earhart's real-life flight pattern. It's up to you to manage the wear-and-tear on your plane as the adventure unfolds, to use weather patterns to your advantage, and to make tough decisions about fueling, gear, repairs and rest. You'll need a little luck, too! Climb into the cockpit and take off into twin-engined fame and glory...your destiny awaits!

—description from the publisher

name: Gridlock
description:
A word game played on a pad of custom game sheets. Each player has a 5x4 grid in which letters are placed. Players take turns to call out any letter they want, which both players must enter into their grid.

After all the spaces are filled points are scored for words formed horizontally and vertically; words filling an entire column are worth two points and words filling an entire row are worth three points.

name: Quadrim
description:
Quadrim is played on an board of alternating small and large squares; each small square is surrounded by four large ones and each large square is surrounded by four of each. (It is therefore equivalent to a board of octagons and squares.)

Each player has two types of pieces: blocks (large discs) and pawns (small pointed cylinders). A large square can hold one block or up to four pawns (possibly from both players); a small square can only only a pawn.

On a turn both players roll two dice and the high roller gets to move; they can move two pieces, one with each die, or one piece using the sum of the dice. If they exceed the opponent's roll by at least four they must move blocks, otherwise they must move pawns.

The object of the game is to either surround the center square with your pieces or capture all opposing pieces. Capturing is generally done by occupying the large squares adjacent to opposing pieces with your own (there are seven different cases covered in the rules).

The game board is made of rolled-up vinyl, packaged with the pieces and rules in a large tube.

name: Jackpot! Break the Bank
description:
Jackpot! Break the Bank is a slot machine deck builder for 1-4 players where players are trying to earn money and victory points, and use their earnings to optimize their decks and attempt to hit the legendary Jackpot! - Breaking the bank!

The game is played simultaneously. Each round players get to draw two cards to their hand, and then 'pull the lever' and draw the top three cards in your slot machine deck into your three slots. Players now get to play a card from their hand into the slot machine to change the outcome.

The goal of the game is to hit payouts. Payouts occur when a player has three symbols of the same kind: ie. ???. When hitting a payout, the player is awarded a â­

Players will be optimizing their decks by sending cards to their opponents as well as purchasing cards that will yield bigger winnings.

The end game condition is triggered when any player "breaks the bank" which is a term used by the casinos when a player is winning more money than is currently available.

One cool feature in this game is that you never shuffle your deck. Once your slot machine deck is depleted - you simply stack your three slots into a new deck. This means that when playing cards from your hand, you will organize your deck and increase your chances of hitting payouts.

Players will also have 4 personal objectives that can be completed in a specific order. These are for instance to hit a payout using cherries. The next objective could be to win with melons. The final objective is always to hit the Jackpot ?

When there is no more money in the bank. The game ends - and the players count all â­ they have on their cards. â­ they got from completing their objectives, as well as any â­-tokens they got for hitting a payout.

The player who has the most â­ wins Jackpot! Break the bank.

-description from designer

name: Hamster Race
description:
Line up your hamsters on the starting grid, roll the die and you’re off! Race around the track, pick up cheese and tip the see-saw to let your hamster ride the wheel.

Cheer on your hamster as they whizz around and try to hold on! The last hamster on the wheel wins the round and gets to keep the cheese in their mouth. The player with the most cheese after 3 rounds wins the game!

name: Perilous Tales
description:
Perilous Tales is a solo and co-operative skirmish miniatures game of thrilling tabletop adventures.

Fend off unknown beasts in an Arctic camp. Uncover evil doings in an abandoned church. Hunt the wild beast of the Hemwich moors. Ghosts, vampires, evil genius, Russian spies, witches, fiends from beyond the stars... You are only limited by your collection of miniatures and your imagination.

Perilous Tales is a solo or fully cooperative game for playing tabletop games with 28mm miniatures from 1890 to 1990. You create a band of heroes; using a flexible and simple character creation system; generate an episode and play it to its thrilling conclusion!

In each episode, the villain and its minions are controlled by the game, using a simple “programming” system. Each episode will have several objectives that your characters will be striving to complete before the time runs out or the plucky heroes are slain.  The play area is beset with threat markets, which may be perilous terrain, or the terrible beasts that are hunting you.

In Perilous Tales, the emphasis is not always on killing, in fact often you are trying to take a critical photograph, recover a crucial artefact, or escape to achieve fame, fortune, or simply to live to another day.

—description from the designer

name: Tetreats
description:
Delivery people look for the best routes to deliver delicious customer orders on time. Optimize your deliveries well if you want to become the best delivery man.

Tetreats is a light roll & write game in which each player will be a food delivery boy who will have to find the best combinations, using Tetris figures, to deliver the food in the most efficient way.

—description from the publisher

Los repartidores buscan las mejores rutas para entregar a tiempo los deliciosos pedidos de los clientes. Optimiza bien tus entregas si quieres convertirte en el mejor repartidor.

Tetreats es un ligero juego roll & write en el que cada uno de los jugadores será un repartidor de comida que tendrá que buscar las mejores combinaciones, utilizando figuras de Tetris, para entregar la comida de la manera más eficiente.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

name: Ulaya Chronicles: Raptor Claw Island
description:
A solo/cooperative skirmish scale miniatures game set in a land of dinosaur infested jungles and ancient technology.

Played over a series of interconnected games, Ulaya Chronicles is a story based campaign experience.
Make important choices which effect the narrative, steer the combat style of your character, and reveal a mysterious plot which you, the players, must unravel.

A solo or cooperative experience, Ulaya Chronicles features a card driven AI system. Each type of enemy (mostly dinosaurs!) have unique behaviours and personalities. Each enemy type is a different tactical puzzle to solve, and ensure every play through is a different experience.

—description from the publisher

name: Hyperspace War
description:
War has broken out between the Grendaran and Kalforian fleets. The two space fighter forces have met in deep space for the final battle. The winner will control the galaxy.

The fleets are evenly matched in both quantity and quality. It will be the skill of their commanders which determines the outcome.

Both the Grendaran and Kalforian fighters are equipped with plasma-drive engines for travel in normal spacetime. Both are also equipped with antimatter hyperdrive engines for traveling through hyperspace. And both have auto-tracking weapons systems for destroying enemy spacecraft.

Hyperspace War is a free PNP two-player space combat game based on the traditional Indonesian board game Surakarta. This game has a unique mechanism which uses looping paths to jump from one position on the board to another.

To play, you will need:
Gameboard (in four sections)
1 sheet of 24 space fighter counters
1d6

Destroy the enemy fleet to win.

—description from the designer

name: The Only Word Cubes
description:
The sequel in the popular series The Only Word - now on dice!

Call for your imagination and think of The Only One Word to describe several different images on the dice. It is a fast game, in which everyone plays for themself. Very compact, with handy components and easy rules, for any number of players – it is a party game which works great even on picnics or trips, as you do not need a table to play it.

Roll 9 special dice with images and put them on the colored game board, right in the box. Each player is dealt an equal number of challenge cards. The color code on the challenge cards indicates the dice on the game board. The task is to find a one-word association to describe (or bridge) 2 or even 3 images of your secret challenge task. The other players should crack the clue and guess right your dice. The fastest player to guess and the Cluegiver each discard 1 challenge card. The winner is the first player who got rid of the challenge cards.

The game is great fun! It sharpens your wits, hones your imagination and helps you to tune up with your friends.
The game also has cooperative and solo modes.

—description from the publisher

name: Strife of Gods
description:
Strife of Gods is a tactical card game for 2-5 players, set in the same medieval fantasy universe as Adellos.

The Gods that created Tarnaris are in a conflict and you, as the players, try to figure out which side will win. You gradually take cards from the card-circle and place them face up in front of you. Each player tries to outplay the others by planning turns in advance and using specific skills from champions to disrupt enemy strategies. The game can be varied greatly to fit your playing style and is easy enough to be learned in the first round in about 2-3 Minutes.

Number cards and champion cards are shuffled separately and placed into two decks. Put the sorted victory point cards aside, they are only needed at the end of every round. Now a circle is laid out. The size of the circle and the number of cards and champions depends on the number of players and the variant the players agree on. For the first game of a group of new players the champions can be dispensed with.

A game consists of a number of rounds equal to the player number. At the end of each round the best players gain points. A round consists of 5 turns per player. The game ends when each player was starting player of a round. The winner is determined after the last round. If players tie for victory, they all win.

—description from the publisher

name: DIEKPLUS
description: These rules may be used to recreate most naval engagements within a period from about 3000 BC to 1000 AD. This covers the birth of naval warfare as such, the Classical Greek era, the Roman era, and also overlaps into the Byzantine period to some extent

name: Conscious: A Voyage to the Mystic Realms
description:
Theme:
Inspired by the ancient wisdom of the Vedic seers, this game attempts to introduce the properties of Chakras. Chakras are centers of consciousness and vitality. They are the energy vortices on the etheric body which envelops the physical body. When understood, mastered and balanced, chakras invoke certain abilities that allow us to become adept in the respective fields. This game deals with 6 chakras and their associated properties. The knowledge of these properties is a step towards obtaining the key to different realms.

Objective:
Aim of the game is to collect and make sets of cards associated with properties of chakras, thus symbolically attaining the knowledge with properties of all chakras to become CONSCIOUS of oneself!

Gameplay:
Chakra property cards are dealt to players who then attempt to make sets of cards. Basic and advanced versions define the nature of these sets. The game is played across multiple rounds, where each round focuses on claiming one chakra and use the associated ability (unique for each Chakra) in the subsequent round. The player to claim all the Chakras wins the game. Variants have also been suggested to alter gameplay length and/or complexity.

The subject of the game is suitable for all ages, making this a family-friendly game.

—description from the publisher

name: Reckless Sloths
description:
Reckless Sloths is a strategic card game about saving sloths from CRAZY dangers!

The cute and cuddly sloths have gone out of control! They are no longer “hanging” around in the trees sleeping. You must save these adorable creatures from CRAZY dangers, by using ridiculous items such as A Taco fishing pole, Helpful batcat, Wonderful pink unicorn, and a Depressed rain cloud.

But heads up… Other players will try to overshadow your heroism. Use your powers to stop them, and become the hero of the sloths!

—description from the designer

name: Opportunities Game
description:
Opportunities is an exciting game where you roll the dice and Backpack your way up Peaks and down Valleys as you strive to roll your way into the Inner Circle and land on your Dream all the while making a fortune doing it. Learn the Business Secrets that have been handed down for generations with a Fun, Financial and Educational Business Board Game. 
You are an Entrepreneur who loves to win and in turn make a fortune doing it. As you and your fellow Entrepreneurs Backpack up Peaks and down Valleys you learn the time proven methods of other successful Entrepreneurs who have come before you. By following the concepts and techniques you will learn how to be a winner and earn a fortune in any business.

—description from the designer

name: Lazer Chess
description:
Lazer Chess is played with an ordinary Chess set with the provided stickers applied to some pieces to distinguish them. It also requires a record pad (included).

Pieces are named after spaceships, e.g. Starfighter, Deth[sic] Star. They do not capture by replacement as in Chess; instead pieces fire at each other from a distance. Every piece has a strength which, along with the distance from the target, determines how much damage it does. The damage is deducted from the target's strength; when a piece reaches zero it is removed. The current strengths of the pieces are tracked on the pad.

The object of the game is to capture the enemy Command Vessel.

name: Sayulita Swell
description:
This gnarly solo game is perfectly suited for the min-max brain to get the highest score and limit the chance of losing energy on the wrong waves. The varibilty of WAVE SWELLS (shuffling of WAVE sheets) brings new challenges each game. We are stoked for you to come shread the WAVES of Sayulita, Mexico!

Sayulita Swell is a solo play Surfing game that will keep you coming back to the swell to score higher and higher points. Using dice rolling, push-your-luck and point management, the surfer tries to catch ever changing waves of the Sayulita Surf Break.

SET UP - Each game you take on 12 different SWELLS, choosing the best 6 WAVES to ride. Paddle out and move your pawn to find the ideal spot on the WAVE to score points and use your ENERGY wisely. Every oncoming WAVE is different from the last. You never know what is coming bro.

AVOID WIPEOUTS - Dive under or bail on WAVES that have a bad break. But dude be careful to use your ENERGY wisely so you can maximize your points and set up well on the WAVE .

THE PERFECT ROLL - Catch the perfect wave and score a gnarly ride by rolling two 6 sided dice to match the number your pawn is on. Or, use ENERGY points to catch the WAVE without needing to risk a dice roll.

SCORE BIG - Choose your RIGHT or LEFT side of the wave, then score big and even CARVE out to net even bigger payouts. Get amped and try for bigger and better scores each game bro.

UNIQUE PLAYERBOARDS - Test your skills with different surf styles on each of the 4 PLAYERBOARDS, all with unique point placements, abilities, and strengths/ weaknesses.

—description from the designer

name: Chessnuts
description:
Chessnuts is a collection of seven four-player Chess variants and one four-player Checkers variant. They are all played on an 8x8 board with four 2x8 wings.

In five of the Chess variants each player plays individually. The games differ in their victory conditions - in three the object is to be the last player with a king, in the other two captured and remaining pieces are scoring using a points system - the game-ending condition, and the effects of losing one's king.

The other two Chess variants are played in partnerships; in one the players sit opposite each other and in the other they sit adjacent.

All the games are named after types of nut, e.g. the adjacent partners game is called Hazelnut.

The components are a roll-up vinyl board and four sets of plastic pieces, all packaged in a tube.

name: Graffiti
description:
Graffiti consists of two decks of cards. One deck of 40 cards each have four subjects on one side and a number from 3-8 on the other. Each round one of these cards is turned over to reveal the categories; players have to come up with a word fitting one of these categories of the length shown by the next card.

The other deck contains 52 cards each showing two different letters. Players all draw the correct number of cards and then race to make a valid word. Players unable to make a word can draw and discard.

The player first making a word scores 10 points per letter plus an extra 10 if the word contains a letter that is also in the category. Play continues until someone reaches 200 points.

name: Return Home
description:
"Wha... ...ed? Thi... Tanegashima!"
Those were the last words from the spaceship Tsuwabuki.

The spaceship lost control, and the twinkles of stars flew past the windows in all directions.

Suddenly, the spaceship shook violently. Aki was thrown about before she could think. 
She quickly lost consciousness.

In this game, the players work together using the Rovers to help rebuild the spaceship. The asteroid is far away so the players must send their commands to their Rovers at once. Then the Rovers will carry out each step. So the players must plan ahead and guess the future.

But sometimes the commands are lost. Solar winds, or sandstorms on the asteroid might disrupt the programming. A Rover might break down. 
Let’s join forces, work as a team, repair Tsuwabuki, and bring our friend Aki back to Earth.

Project: RETURN HOME.

The game consistes of some roles, one is a Monitor and the rest are Rover players.

The Rover players select and put three cards face down from their hand choosing from: "Run","Survey", "Repair" and "Recharge Battery".

Then the Monitor chooses 2 cards to avoid from the 5 disaster cards in a row.

The remaining three disasters affect the Rover player's cards in the corresponding order.

So, if the disaster is a sandstorm, the player who chose "Run" will take damage. Actions may be canceled after the Emergency.
In addition, players should be aware of Astronaut Aki.

The Oxygen is limited. You have to find materials from the asteroid and supply the oxygen before it runs out.

Find and assemble the Spaceship parts before all Rovers are destroyed! And let Aki return home! Then, players win the game!

name: Falling Sky: La RÃ©volte des Gaulois contre CÃ©sar (Deluxe Edition)
description:
Falling Sky: The Gallic Revolt Against Caesar, formerly Gallic War, takes 1 to 4 players into the military actions and complex politics of Roman-occupied but not-yet-conquered Gaul. Caesar and his hard-hitting legions cannot be everywhere and will not triumph without powerful allies among local tribes. But each Gallic confederation has its own agenda and must keep its eyes not only on the Romans but also on Celtic, Belgic, and Germanic rivals. Players recruit forces, rally allies, husband resources for war, and balance dispersed action with the effectiveness and risk of concentrated battle.

The Deluxe Edition includes both the base game of Falling Sky and Ariovistus expansion presented together in a square box with the "Vercingetorix throws down his arms at the feet of Julius Caesar" painting as cover art.

Released as an Ulule campaign, a Wogomat neoprene mat with the Gaul map cn also be included (mat dimensions: 100cm x 60cm x 2 mm).

name: The Pooh Game
description:
In which Pooh and his friends race through the 100 Aker Wood, collecting honeypots as they go!

This game is a dice rolling game, in which players take turns to roll dice, and move their characters along the spaces. As they travel through the game board they will collect honeypots. But beware! Sometimes you might lose a honeypot.

It's not a race to the finish. The winner is the player with the most honeypots at the end of the game.

Based on the original E.H.Shepard illustrations for Winnie the Pooh books.

Made in England.

name: Taumant's Lair
description:
Taumant's Lair is a dice game for a single player with a duration of approximately 20 minutes. To play you need six six-sided dice, each not exceeding 0.5 inches, about eight pawns, and a dozen counters or tokens. If you do not have any pawns nor counters.
The game is divided into three different parts, each corresponding to three pages, which you will use as game boards. Print each one on a different sheet of cardboard and follow their instructions.

Part I: Recruiting Adventurers
The first step to penetrate Taumant's lair is to form a party capable of surviving its many hazards. Luckily, you are near to the city-state of Kalazar, located between two kingdoms at war. It makes Kalazar the perfect place to look for adventurers. You must explore the city and try to recruit people prepared to risk their lives.

Part II: The Dungeon
It's the time! Your party is about to get into the cavern. Your goal is to get through its six levels with as few losses as possible. You will play six turns, each corresponding one level of the cave. Put the pawns representing your adventurers on the appropriate square of the column 'ready' and another one on the first level of the dungeon. If you beat the sixth level, you will face Taumant in Part III with your surviving adventurers!

Part III: Taumant!
You have arrived at Taumant's chamber. This will be a tough fight! As soon as he meets the adventurers, he prepares himself to reduce his enemies to ashes with his deadly fire breath. You have only three turns before he buries your party in a hell of flames. Every unwounded adventurer has a roll for every turn. Put this sheet 12 inches from you and roll a die towards the dragon; if it stops on him, you will cause damage points depending on its location. If you cause 50 or more damage points, you win! Otherwise, you can return to Part I and try again.

—description from the designer

name: Piraten auf Schatzsuche
description:
The jung pirates going on a treasure hunt using a secret treasure map. They have to find out how to avoid danger and get quickest to the final. This game is training memory and strategic thinking. 
The main goal is to reach the pirate beach with the treasure. This can be archived only if they roll the exact numbers on the dice.

—user summary

name: Fall Barbarossa
description: Double - "single" - blind game of Operation Barbarossa, published in Six Angles #15.  15 hexes Warsaw to Moscow, so 48 miles per hex.

name: Oh, Whelp!
description:
Oh, Whelp! is a communist-style card drafting game. You play as a dragon and guide them on their journey of self-development. Three Companion cards are drawn each round, each of which offer strengths and weaknesses to your dragon's personality.

Players simultaneously choose the Companion best suited for their dragon's character goals. Points are marked along their own individual trait tracker. The Companion card deck is played through twice (16 rounds). Personality points are tallied and the dragon with the highest-scoring personality wins!

This light party game is an ideal opener at game nights or when playing with folks who might be inexperienced with heavier games. The multiplayer solitaire format easily allows for solo play and up to an unlimited number of players. Oh, Whelp! is a free game to print and play and can be played virtually, making it highly accessible to all. Did we mention it is heavily infused with puns?

name: Lost Temple of Gold
description:
Lost Temples of Gold is a Solitaire Roll & Write game where you are an explorer that has been commissioned by the king to sail to distant lands, explore the terrain and bring back Diamonds, Gems and Artifacts. You will have a set number of Crew and Soldiers to explore but you better leave some crew and soldiers behind to protect the ship from the hostile natives. As you explore the three Islands, you will develop a map to help you along the way. You will also need to collect or buy wood to build a raft so you can cross to the next island. Two of the Islands have Tribal Chiefs that are hidden and you must find. These Chiefs will each give you half of the secret location of the temple.

The Chief will either greet you with hostility or friendship depending on how you treat his people. As you explore you will come across different types of villages that you can trade with or overtake if necessary. Some will be hostile and automatically attack you while others will be friendly. Keep track of your food because if you run out your crew will start to die from starvation. Try to obtain medicine in case your crew get sick from the natives. Once you've spoke with both Chiefs you will have the secret location and can travel to the last island. Search the island and find the Temple to set your name in history and your King the richest in the nation. If you lose all your crew you lose the game.

—description from the designer

name: The Second Most Perfect Moment
description:
Suddenly, a portal opens up and someone walks through it - not just anyone, but you. Again.

Before you can say anything, the other you says, “Shut up and listen. This is a time machine. You know what you have to do.” As you are handed the machine, your mind immediately goes back to that one event that you always wished that you could have changed.

This is your chance to change it. You see on the readout that the machine is already primed to go to the exact date and time that you were thinking of. As you press the activate button, the other you says, “Don’t screw it up like I did.”

The Second Most Perfect Moment is a standalone (and combinable) expansion to The Perfect Moment. It's made up of 3 small expansions that were released in 2019.

Players race to rewrite history in their favor using a deck of only 18 cards. Players use equipment, exploit paradoxes in the time-space continuum, and author their own revision of the past. Featuring a clever multi-sided card system, every card is used by both players based on what they can see. Equipping that card for yourself may just give your opponent the ability they were looking for. Every turn, players activate up to two revealed cards, which each have special effects. After the effects are resolved, the player can optionally score a card to earn up to 3 points depending on how closely they match it. The first player to 16 points wins. It takes careful planning and a bit of luck to avoid failing like you have so many times before. This time will be different.

This time...


This can be played on its own or combined with The Perfect Moment and expansions.

Includes 3 previously released expansion sets of the series, and the solo mode rule set:

     1979: A Job Interview Gone Wrong
     1987: A Little Espionage Gone Wrong
     2010: An Escape Plan Gone Wrong
     The Perfect Moment: Echoes (2nd version)

name: Listen Up
description:
Created by The Kindness Collective, Listen Up is a conversational board game that tests your listening skills and inspires deeper connections between friends and family! Packaged into a compact and easy-to-play game with over 250 questions and activities, ranging from deep and meaningful to light-hearted and fun, Listen Up is guaranteed to reveal untold stories, heartfelt moments, and plenty of laughs with those closest to you!

The game is simple. Each player moves around the board answering personal questions according to the category they land on. Other players can delve deeper into their answers by using GET REAL cards, and make sure to remember their responses to gain extra points at the end!

—description from the publisher

name: Superhit
description:
Superhit is a set of many games designed for education in arithmetic. The common components are dice, counters in five colors, and a 10x10 board with numbered spaces; the numbers also have various colors.

Some of the later games are suitable for play by adults. In one, players roll four dice and then must use arithmetic operations to produce a number on the board, which they place a counter on. When certain dice combinations are rolled the player with the top counter on a space may move the stack. The object is generally to reach the edge of the board, but (as with all the games in the set) there are many variants and optional rules.

name: Counteract
description:
Counteract is played on a 6x6 board with the squares numbered from 1-6; one space of each number is a "magic square" with a star on it. Each player has a supply of counters.

On a typical turn a player rolls a die and places a counter on an empty space with the matching number. They may take another turn if a 6 is rolled. Each player may make a "power play" three times during the game; this involves rolling two dice and allows replacing an opposing piece at the designated coordinates if there is one.

The game ends when one player uses all their pieces. Scoring is primarily based on forming lines of six pieces and on occupying the magic squares, although there are some extra points available to the player who goes out.

name: That's My Throne
description:
“The King Lorenzo XIV of Bastardoom has been kept captive by “Lizardzilla”, a humongous creature that inhabits in the periphery of the realm, and since all of his sons are adopted, he did not choose an inheritor. What a problem. The king’s council decided that the one which is most suitable among them shall obtain the throne of the realm, but how do they to be worthy? A challenge said the eldest and wisest of the council. Let the boys show their abilities to rule. All their desitions will be evaluated. Will you be able to demonstrate that you are a worthy successor of your father?”

Welcome to That’s My Throne, a Roll & Write boardgame, in which you take the role of one of the inheritors of the realm of Bastardoom, and in order to gain Glory points, you must develop community work. Be the one who obtains more Glory Points and, places the crown of victory on your head!

—description from the designer

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 8 â€“ Setting up Shop
description:
After aiding the downed Liberation ships, the Tempus follows them into space, her home planet no longer safe. A nearby moon has been chosen for the Liberation's new headquarters. These ships are loaded with supplies and crew to build it, but any help would be appreciated.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer

name: Tempus Quest: Episode 10 â€“ The Asteroid Scene
description:
Having completed their attack on the Dynasty outpost the Liberation fleet attempts a hasty retreat but are cut off by an armada of Dynasty reinforcements. Seeing an escape route, the Tempus leads the other ships into an asteroid belt, hoping the armada wouldn't be so bold as to do the same.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer

name: The Big Score
description:
A dicey game about getting in and getting out.

Inspired in the cult film Ocean's  Eleven.


The Big Score is a competitive craps-like dice rolling game about attempting to rob a casino and get out first.

The game is played over multiple rounds, with each round having the players take turns trying to move their crew to the vault, or out past the lobby, while the non-active players place bets on what they will roll, trying to get a bonus advancement for their own crew.


The Big Score is the postcard game from Button Shy's April 2016 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.

name: Tubthumping
description:
Get knocked down, but get up again in this barroom brawl.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Tubthumping by Chumbawamba.

Chip Beauvais and Sara Beauvais team up again for the third(?) Button Shy project, and I imagine there are more to come too. In Thubtumping, players will try to get one of each drink (coin) by fistbumping a player that has a smaller coin than you. Being realtime, it can feel like a barroom brawl, and with all of those fists flying, it could accidentally turn into one.

—description from the publisher


Tubthumping is a simultaneous play competitive game of drinking and brawling. Players supply coins or tokens to play, and attempt to win mini-brawls with each other in order to collect one coin or token of each color. The first one to do so wins.


Tubthumping is the postcard game from Button Shy's June 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.

name: What's Your Number?!
description:
You have something to hold onto, but are a few digits short.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song 867-5309 / Jenny by Tommy Tutone.

Ryan Cowler designed a game about missing digits, for what may be the most famous phone number ever, 867-5309. Tommy Tutone (remember them? or him? Nope.) caused some chaos for a few unlucky people that actually had this phone number in the 80's and 90's, and now you can cause some of your own by trying to mix up the digits for your opponent.

—description from the publisher


What's Your Number?! is a Mastermind type game of one player setting a pattern, and the others trying to figure out the pattern, all themed around figuring out the phone number that Jenny wrote on your hand at the club last night... All you can make out is 867-XXXX


What's Your Number?! is the postcard game from Button Shy's July 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.

name: Flo'Busta
description:
Try not to drop the beat.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Ice Ice Baby by Vanilla Ice.


Flo'Busta card-drafting game of making mixes in the club for 2-4 players. Each turn you draft a card matching either the suit or rank of you previous card, taking a face down card if you can't match. The player with the longest run of matched cards after 10 rounds is the winner.

Flo'Busta is the postcard game from Button Shy's August 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.

name: Fast as Lightning
description:
Use expert fighting and it won't be frightening.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Kung Fu Fighting by Carl Douglas.


Fast as Lightning is a real-time card shedding game in which 2 players compete to get rid of their cards as fast as possible while preventing their opponent from doing the same.


Fast as Lightning is the postcard game from Button Shy's September 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.

name: Slam Dance
description:
Show off your skills in the mosh pit.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song The Safety Dance by Men Without Hats.


Slam Dance is a card and dice game for 2 or 4 (partnership) players. where each player or team attempts to be the best dancer in a mosh pit simulated with dice and playing cards that the players provide.


Slam Dance is the postcard game from Button Shy's October 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month Club.

name: Funkytown
description:
Move and groove your way into Funkytown.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song Funkytown by Lipps Inc..


Funkytown is an action selection game of dancing down the road to Funkytown. Players use a deck of cards to simulate their moves and guide their tokens on the board to the section of Funkytown that they have to reach. First player to reach their location wins and gets their groove on.


Funkytown is the postcard game from Button Shy's November 2017 edition of the Board Game of the Month club.

name: Lost in the Shadows
description:
Inspired on the cult film The Lost Boys.


Lost in the Shadows is a hidden role game where the players take on the role of citizens of Santa Carla who are suffering the wrath of a vampire. They must work together to uncover who among them is the head vampire and stop them before time runs out.


Postcard release in the January 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Goat Slingers
description: Your goal is simple: launch your goat, land it on the cliffs and try to be the last one standing. Ready, set, GOAT! Grab the Goat-a-pult, pull down on the launcher and fling your goat onto the cliffs. If your goat sticks the landing, collect your token(s) and leave your goat in place until your next turn to create an obstacle for your opponents!

name: Mister Rogers' Neighborhood: The Game
description:
In this simple-to-learn children's game, players spin the spinner and move their trolleys around the board, attempting to visit each of the landmarks and neighbors in the Neighborhood of Make-Believe: Grandpere at the Eiffel Tower, King Friday and Queen Sara at the castle, Corny at the Rock-It Factory, X & Henrietta Pussycat at the tree, Lady Elaine at the Museum-Go-Round, Dr. Bill and Elsie Jean at the platypus mound, and Daniel Tiger at the clock.

Along the way, Mister Rogers cards offer bonuses and penalties (often with a motivational thought to soften the blow of the penalties). Landing on a Trolley space offers an extra turn.

The game offers three methods of play:
1. Players must circle the board and collect all seven of the Neighbor cards by landing at the colored landmarks for each one.
2. Players start with all seven cards and must "drop off" each Neighbor at their landmarks.
3. The "Advanced" game, in which players must collect all seven neighbor cards, and once all seven are collected, drop them off.

The game box suggests a minimum age of 6 years old, but the game is about on par with something like Candy Land. Ages 4 and 5 can learn and play it.
